nodes.text:
The scheduling counter is still a cage of glass and forms. (pause)
The press. The substitution board. The no-show bin—nothing has moved. (pause)
Only you have these. (pause)
An AMR calls you “standing.” (pause)
A TER calls you “processable.” (pause)
A slot token calls you “in custody.”
Next. Tray forward.
At the caged window…

choices.text: talk: Next.
show: Slot token. AMR. TER. Here for Interconnection Work Order / Clearance.
ask: What do you need, exactly, to issue the IWO?
ask: Does the TER change anything for you?
ask: What’s the failure mode. What gets returned?
ask: Upstream authorization—who’s upstream?
bargain: Fiscal cutoff. I need this to move.
threaten: If this stalls, I document it as scheduling obstruction.
show: Cite OLEA standing. Request escalation.
leave: Step away from the cage.

nodes.text: Next.

Good. You’re here. (pause)
Keep “request” and “grant” out of your mouth— (pause)
those words make stories. (pause)
You present custody. (pause)
I record custody. (pause)
That’s the clean lane through glass.

choices.text: show: Slot token. AMR. TER. Issue the IWO clearance.
ask: What do you need, exactly, to issue the IWO?
ask: What’s the failure mode. What gets returned?
talk: Back.
leave: Step away.

nodes.text: What do you need to issue the IWO? (pause) Exactly.

I need a claimable slot asset. (pause)
In your custody. (pause)
And a packet that doesn’t make me guess. (pause)
Slot token covers time as property. (pause)
AMR covers you holding it. (pause)
Keeps it from becoming a felony noun. (pause)
TER says the site is eligible today. (pause)
Eligible yeah. (pause)
Then I can issue the Interconnection Work Order. (pause)
Clearance packet. (pause)
And issue here means I log what's here.

choices.text: show: Slot token. AMR. TER. Do it.
ask: So what’s the part you can’t guarantee?
talk: Back.
leave: Step away.

nodes.text: So what’s the part you can’t guarantee?

Outcomes. (pause)
I can tell you what usually survives review. (pause)
I’m not promising what review decides. (pause)
If you need guarantees, keep walking.
Does the TER change anything for you?

It changes what I’m allowed to write. (pause)
Without TER, slot token’s stamped. Nowhere to go. (pause)
With TER it’s a time asset. (pause)
In a process lane. (pause)
Lanes keep my desk out of precedent.

choices.text: show: Slot token. AMR. TER. Issue the IWO clearance.
ask: What’s the failure mode. What gets returned?
talk: Back.
leave: Step away.

nodes.text: What’s the failure mode. What gets returned?

File reads: “Returned for deficiency.” (pause)
Deficiency can be chain continuity gaps. (pause)
Custody conflicts. (pause)
Or upstream flags node not in good standing. (pause)
That last one isn’t on me. (pause)
I’m saying now so it stays off me.

choices.text: ask: Not in good standing how?
show: Slot token. AMR. TER. Record it and issue the packet.
talk: Back.
leave: Step away.

nodes.text: Not in good standing how?

Everything’s filled out. Still won’t move. (pause)
Outstanding disputes. Unresolved incidents. Unclosed loops. (pause)
Sometimes upstream just… stops. (pause)
Node doesn’t get treated as eligible. (pause)
That’s routing. Don’t make it a sermon.

choices.text: ask: Who is upstream?
show: Proceed. Issue the IWO clearance.
talk: Back.
leave: Step away.

nodes.text: Who is upstream?

Upstream is whoever can say “no” elsewhere. (pause)
I’m not naming names. (pause)
You’ll chase them, then my diagram changes. (pause)
So it stays “upstream.” (pause)
That’s what gets recorded.
Upstream authorization—who’s upstream?

It’s a direction on the chart. (pause)
That direction can refuse you before it enters. (pause)
Put a person there, it's an argument. (pause)
I’m not running arguments through this glass.

choices.text: show: Slot token. AMR. TER. Issue the IWO clearance packet.
ask: So you’re saying this can still stall.
talk: Back.
leave: Step away.

nodes.text: So you’re saying this can still stall.

Yeah, it can stall. (pause)
Packet can be spotless. (pause)
Still comes back. (pause)
I stamp so the return reads like policy. (pause)
Not a story.
Fiscal cutoff. I need this to move.

Fiscal cutoff doesn’t change clearance. (pause)
That’s your deadline. (pause)
Deadlines don’t go on my stamps. (pause)
If you’ve got custody, keep the chain continuous.
If this stalls, I document scheduling obstruction.

Document whatever you want. (pause)
Just use the right nouns. (pause)
“Obstruction” drags intent into it. (pause)
Then it drags a person in. (pause)
I’m not volunteering. (pause)
Present custody. (pause)
Or leave.

choices.text: show: Slot token. AMR. TER. Issue the packet.
talk: Back.
leave: Step away.

nodes.text:
Standing. Noted. (pause)
Still doesn’t make a slot. (pause)
I’m not inventing process at this window. (pause)
If I escalate, it’s discretionary. (pause)
My name goes on the record. (pause)
Precedent brings review. (pause)
I’m not feeding that.

choices.text: show: Fine. Slot token. AMR. TER. Record and issue.
ask: Upstream authority—what are they watching for?
talk: Back.
leave: Step away.

nodes.text: Upstream authority—what are they watching for?

Continuity. (pause)
No blanks. (pause)
No cute handwriting. (pause)
No new verbs. (pause)
If the node’s flagged, it bounces either way. (pause)
Stamps won’t save it. (pause)
So yeah—I stamp like I’m being watched.

Declarations don’t run this window. (pause)
Show standing in-chain before you start invoking it. (pause)
Escalation won’t replace custody.

choices.text: show: Slot token. AMR. TER.
talk: Back.
leave: Step away.

nodes.text: Slot token. AMR. TER. Interconnection Work Order/Clearance.

Good. Actual objects. I can record those. (pause)
Slide the token to the line. (pause)
Keep the serial visible. (pause)
And say it straight: “Interconnection Work Order—Clearance.” (pause)
You start calling it “permission” or “approval”… (pause)
it turns into a different disaster.
The tray waits under the glass…

choices.text: give: Hand over the slot token.
ask: What does upstream need to see on this packet?
look: Look at the stamp substitution board.
talk: Back.
leave: Step away.

nodes.text:
The substitution board hangs slightly crooked, corners curled from being handled and put back. (pause)
Approved workarounds, formalized. (pause)
It reads like a promise: the chain can tolerate reality as long as reality is stamped.
What must upstream see on this packet?

Continuity. (pause)
No blanks. (pause)
No new verbs. (pause)
If the node’s flagged, upstream bounces it. (pause)
Clean stamps or not. (pause)
That’s routing.
You slide the token into the tray. (pause) The clerk doesn’t pick it up at first—just studies impression, like it might change its mind.

Serial matches the recovery ledger. (pause)
Tolerance band’s tight. (pause)
Don’t treat it like a suggestion. (pause)
AMR standing’s valid. (pause)
TER is current. (pause)
So I can do my part— (pause)
and stay boring.

Paper moves behind the glass.
A stamp lands, lifts, lands again—measured and tender in its violence.

Interconnection Work Order. (pause)
Clearance packet. (pause)
“Provisional pending upstream review.” (pause)
That’s the wording. (pause)
Keep it closed until a checkpoint says so. (pause)
You open it early, it reads like tampering. (pause)
Don’t argue with me—this one’s old.

A thick envelope slides through the lower slot. Edges square. (pause) Corners already worn by expectation. (pause) An extra insert rides with it—paper that doesn’t match the rest. (pause) Folded like it was meant to be found later.
What’s the insert?

Map fragment. Third set. (pause)
Yeah, I know. (pause)
Part of the continuity kit. (pause)
When the corridor signage contradicts itself— (pause)
and it will— (pause)
you’ll want something that stays consistent.
Next—move.
